Based on my search results, here's what I found about CodeRabbit, the AI coding tool, in 2024:

## Overview
CodeRabbit is an AI-powered code reviewer that delivers context-aware feedback on pull requests within minutes, reducing the time and effort needed for manual code reviews.(no content)CodeRabbit was launched in 2023 by a team of former engineering leaders who had felt the pain of slow, manual code reviews firsthand.

## Key Features & Capabilities
Automatically runs popular static analyzers, linters, and security tools combined with Gen-AI's advanced reasoning models.(no content)Code graph analysis enhances context for deeper code understanding, delivering best-in-class signal-to-noise ratio.

The platform offers several advanced features:
- Pull request summaries & sequence diagrams. Linear & Jira issue validation. Autogenerated release notes, daily standup reports, and sprint reviews.
- Your team can have conversations with CodeRabbit about its reviews by replying to it with follow-up comments on pull requests, asking it questions or making observations about the review using natural language. CodeRabbit continues the conversation appropriately, offering further insights about the code changes, or adjusting its own review style based on feedback.

## 2024 Developments

### Funding and Growth
CodeRabbit, which recently closed a Series A funding round, aims to automate the code review process using AI. It also has investments: CodeRabbit today announced a $16 million Series A funding round led by CRV, with participation from Flex Capital and Engineering Capital.

### VS Code Integration
CodeRabbit also recently launched integration into Visual Studio (VS) Code, allowing developers to receive reviews in real time directly in their code editor. The tool now supports both code reviews in VS Code and in Pull Requests, ensuring flexibility for developers to review code individually right as they are coding, as well as collectively in their Pull Requests when all code commits come together.

### Technical Implementation
To solve the problem, CodeRabbit built a powerful multi-step review system powered by OpenAI's LLMs. When a developer submits a pull request, CodeRabbit clones the repository into a sandboxed environment, enriches the diff with additional context that comes from code history, linters, code graph analysis, issue tickets, and developer conversations, before kicking off a multi-model analysis.

## Learning Capabilities
As you interact with CodeRabbit through chat, it learns the review preferences of your team, and applies them to all future reviews on a given repository. This adaptive learning is demonstrated in practice, where it combined the project knowledge with Philip's comment into a specific and precise learning it will use immediately for future code.

## User Reception
Around 600 organizations are paying for CodeRabbit's services today, Gill claims, and CodeRabbit is in pilots with "several" Fortune 500 companies. Users report significant improvements: It has saved us more than 50% of the time we used to spend on manual reviews, allowing our engineers to focus on building great products.

## Security and Privacy
All queries to large language models (LLMs) exist in-memory only, with zero retention after each query completes. We don't use your code, code reviews, or other collected data to train LLMs.

CodeRabbit appears to be a comprehensive AI-powered code review platform that has gained significant traction in 2024, with substantial funding, new integrations, and growing enterprise adoption.

Source code analysis tools, also knownâ€¦ | by Abado Mtulla | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@abado_80887/static-code-analysis-tools-7d0ee794ca09"},{"title":"Embold reviews, pricing and features 2024","url":"https://www.peerspot.com/products/embold-reviews"},{"title":"Embold: Static Code Analyzer Uses AI To Help Developers Analyze And Improve Their Code - MarkTechPost","url":"https://www.marktechpost.com/2020/11/14/embold-static-code-analyzer-uses-ai-to-help-developers-analyze-and-improve-their-code/"},{"title":"Embold AI-based static code analysis platform - IntelÂ® Builders","url":"https://builders.intel.com/ai/solutionscatalog/embold-ai-based-static-code-analysis-platform-650"},{"title":"Spot Bugs as You Code with Emboldâ€™s AI-Enabled Static Analysis and Visualization Tool - The New Stack","url":"https://thenewstack.io/spot-bugs-as-you-code-with-embolds-ai-enabled-static-analysis-and-visualization-tool/"},{"title":"About BrowserStack Code Quality â€“ Code Quality Docs","url":"https://docs.embold.io/about-embold/"},{"title":"Code Quality & Performance with Embold Code Analysis | Scrums.com","url":"https://www.scrums.com/software-development-tools/embold"},{"title":"Embold, a linter for C/Csharp/Cpp - Rating And 5 Alternatives | Analysis Tools","url":"https://analysis-tools.dev/tool/embold"}]

Based on my search results, here's what I found about Embold's static code analysis tool features and capabilities in 2024:

## Key Features and Capabilities

**Core Analysis Dimensions:**
Embold's multi-dimensional scan detects design anti-patterns, vulnerabilities, code issues, code metric violations, and code duplication. The tool analyzes source code across four dimensions: code issues, design issues, metrics and duplication, and surface issues that impact stability, robustness, security, and maintainability.

**AI-Powered Analysis:**
Embold brings static code analysis to the next level - all backed by AI. It analyses source code using natural language processing (NLP), machine learning and a set of algorithms to find design issues, bugs and anti-patterns. It provides AI-enabled recommendations for solving issues the static analyzer finds, almost like an auto-correct for code.

**Code Quality Metrics:**
Embold offers 18 usable code metrics that are among the best in the industry and let you do a deeper assessment. The Embold Score, which is calculated from these four dimensions, helps understand the risk areas and makes it easier to prioritize issues that need to be solved.

**Visualization and Reporting:**
Embold provides code quality reports that include a heat-map of detected issues, which helps visualize the exact components that contribute to smelly code. The output includes visualizations of code quality and complexity, high-level metrics for code quality that you can track over time and a prioritized list of the most significant issues.

## Integration and Platform Support

**Development Environment Integration:**
Embold offers IDE plugins including support for IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio that provide instant feedback as you write code. It comes with support for common continuous development strategies and can be added to GitHub/Bitbucket repositories or enabled in CI/CD pipelines.

**DevOps Integration:**
With its deep integration into the DevOps tool chain, Embold functions as both a next generation static code analysis platform and an AI-powered tool. By integrating with existing DevOps tools such as Jenkins and GitLab, Embold catches issues early and syncs seamlessly with CI/CD tools.

**Language Support:**
It can support over 17 languages like Java, C, C++, C#, Python, etc.

## Deployment Options

Embold offers a customizable, self-hosted version for organizations of all sizes, and is available as cloud and on premise solution and fits teams and companies of all sizes at scale. It comes free for open-source projects.

The tool positions itself as a next-generation static code analysis platform designed to detect code errors, inefficiencies, and vulnerabilitiesâ€”improving code quality right from the start.

Based on the search results, I can provide you with a comparison between Embold and CodeRabbit for static code analysis and AI code review in 2024. Here's what I found:

## Embold vs CodeRabbit Comparison

### CodeRabbit
CodeRabbit has gained attention for its sophisticated AI that automates the detection of complex code anomalies and security vulnerabilities and claims to catch 95%+ bugs. This tool integrates seamlessly with major IDEs and version control systems, providing developers with insights right in their coding environment.

**Key Features:**
- Line-by-line feedback and auto-generated summaries of PRs, with conversational feedback feature within GitHub for real-time interaction with AI
- Automatically runs popular static analyzers, linters, and security tools combined with Gen-AI's advanced reasoning models, with code graph analysis for enhanced context
- Pull request summaries & sequence diagrams, Linear & Jira issue validation, and autogenerated release notes
- Integrates with GitHub, GitLab, and Azure DevOps

**Limitations:**
- Has limitations when reviewing larger context windows and can occasionally provide inaccurate feedback, doesn't perform indexing of your codebase and limits itself to review only the PR at hand
- At $12 per month for just code reviews with no additional features, it works out as an expensive subscription

### Embold
Embold brings static code analysis to the next level - all backed by AI. With Embold's multi-dimensional prioritization, from design to code metrics, it helps you get right into the DNA of your code.

**Key Features:**
- Helps find issues before they happen and integrates with your existing workflow
- Helps understand the status and build high quality software faster, seamlessly integrating into your DevOps
- Traditional static code analysis platform with AI enhancements

### Market Position in 2024
The best overall CodeRabbit alternative is Bitbucket, with other similar apps including GitHub, GitLab, Azure DevOps Server, and Assembla. The landscape shows diverse AI-powered code review tools with unique features, and the adoption of AI in code review tools offers promising improvements in code quality, security, and development workflows.

### Learning Capabilities
CodeRabbit has an interesting learning feature where it combines project knowledge with developer comments into specific and precise learning for future code reviews, learning about the code base and all code reviews and interactions.

The search results suggest that while both tools offer AI-powered static code analysis, CodeRabbit appears to be more focused on real-time PR reviews with conversational AI features, while Embold positions itself as a comprehensive static code analysis platform with AI backing. CodeRabbit seems to have gained more recent attention in the AI code review space, but comes with pricing concerns compared to alternatives.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about CodeRabbit's pricing and free plan options for 2024:

## CodeRabbit Pricing Overview

CodeRabbit offers free use for public repositories, making it completely free for open-source projects. The platform includes a 14-day free usage of the Pro plan with no credit card required.

## Pricing Plans

**Free Options:**
- Free reviews forever for public repositories - simply sign up using GitHub or GitLab and install CodeRabbit on a public repository
- CodeRabbit offers a free plan with limited features
- A Free tier that offers unlimited code-change summaries

**Paid Plans:**
- The Lite plan is an entry-level tier that provides fast and essential AI-powered code reviews, ideal for teams looking for basic AI code review capabilities
- Pricing starts at $16.60 per month
- The CodeRabbit Pro plan costs $15 a month per developer (note: there may be some variation in reported pricing)
- Enterprise tier with access to advanced features and SLA support

## Special Free Pro Plan for Open Source

CodeRabbit has made its Pro plan free for open-source projects, providing the CodeRabbit Pro plan (which normally costs $15 a month per developer) free of charge to open-source developers. However, the rate limits for the "free for open source" Pro plan are lower than the paid plan, and if a project hits the limit, access will be restored after the timeout period.

## Additional Features

CodeRabbit also offers a free AI code reviews extension for Visual Studio Code that runs directly in VS Code, and Open Source, Lite, and Pro plans are available through their GitHub Marketplace listing.

The most current pricing information should be confirmed directly on CodeRabbit's official pricing page, as pricing details were last updated on various dates and may differ from actual current pricing.

Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about Claude Code CLAUDE.md file setup, configuration, and best practices for 2024-2025:

## What is CLAUDE.md?

CLAUDE.md is a special file that Claude automatically pulls into context when starting a conversation.(no content)At its core, a claude.md file is a special Markdown file that Claude Code automatically ingests to gain project-specific context before it starts working

## File Placement and Structure

Claude Code looks for CLAUDE.md files in several locations:

1. **Project root**: The root of your repo, or wherever you run claude from (the most common usage). Name it CLAUDE.md and check it into git so that you can share it across sessions and with your team (recommended), or name it CLAUDE.local.md and .gitignore it

2. **Parent directories**: This is most useful for monorepos, where you might run claude from root/foo, and have CLAUDE.md files in both root/CLAUDE.md and root/foo/CLAUDE.md.

3. **Global user directory**: Your home folder (~/.claude/CLAUDE.md), which applies it to all your claude sessions

## Best Practices for Content

### Keep it Concise
We recommend keeping them concise and human-readable.(no content)The contents of your claude.md are prepended to your prompts, consuming part of your token budget with every interaction. A bloated, verbose file will not only cost more but can also introduce noise that makes it harder for the model to follow the important instructions.

### Writing Style
"You're writing for Claude, not onboarding a junior dev." Do: Use short, declarative bullet points. Don't: Write long, narrative paragraphs.

### Essential Content to Include

Repository etiquette (e.g., branch naming, merge vs. rebase, etc.) Developer environment setup (e.g., pyenv use, which compilers work) Any unexpected behaviors or warnings particular to the project

**Example structure:**
# Bash commands - npm run build: Build the project - npm run typecheck: Run the typechecker # Code style - Use ES modules (import/export) syntax, not CommonJS (require) - Destructure imports when possible (eg. import { foo } from 'bar') # Workflow - Be sure to typecheck when you're done making a series of code changes - Prefer running single tests, and not the whole test suite, for performance

## Advanced Configuration Tips

### Regular Refinement
Your CLAUDE.md files become part of Claude's prompts, so they should be refined like any frequently used prompt. A common mistake is adding extensive content without iterating on its effectiveness. Take time to experiment and determine what produces the best instruction following from the model.

### Using the # Symbol for Quick Updates
You can add content to your CLAUDE.md manually or press the # key to give Claude an instruction that it will automatically incorporate into the relevant CLAUDE.md. Many engineers use # frequently to document commands, files, and style guidelines while coding, then include CLAUDE.md changes in commits so team members benefit as well.

### Optimization Techniques
At Anthropic, we occasionally run CLAUDE.md files through the prompt improver and often tune instructions (e.g. adding emphasis with "IMPORTANT" or "YOU MUST") to improve adherence.

## Automatic Generation

When you run the /init command, Claude will automatically generate a CLAUDE.md for you.(no content)Typing /init after launching Claude Code in a project directory will prompt Claude to analyze your codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file with essential information.

## Team Collaboration

You can override global settings for a specific project by creating a CLAUDE.md and CLAUDE.local.md in the root of that project. The first is intended to be committed and the second is intended to be ignored.

The CLAUDE.md file serves as "the constitution for your AI assistant, the document that elevates it from a generic tool to a specialized, project-aware developer." Following these best practices will help you create an effective configuration that improves Claude Code's performance and consistency across your development workflow.
